title: Immunology Vocabulary
description: Learn the language of the immune system, from antibodies and antigens to vaccines and the body's remarkable defense mechanisms.

questions.question: What is an 'antibody'?
options: A protein produced by the immune system to identify and neutralize foreign substances
A type of white blood cell

questions.question: What is an 'antigen'?
options: A substance that triggers an immune response, often found on the surface of pathogens

questions.question: What does 'immunity' mean?
options: The ability of an organism to resist a particular infection or toxin
The process of healing a wound

questions.question: What is a 'vaccine'?
options: A biological preparation that provides active acquired immunity to a particular disease

questions.question: What are 'lymphocytes'?
options: A type of white blood cell central to the immune response, including T cells and B cells

questions.question: What does 'inflammation' indicate?
options: The body's protective response to injury or infection, characterized by redness, swelling, heat, and pain

questions.question: What is an 'autoimmune disease'?
options: A disease that only affects children
A disease caused by a virus
A condition where the immune system mistakenly attacks the body's own healthy cells

questions.question: What are 'T cells'?
options: A type of lymphocyte that plays a central role in cell-mediated immunity

questions.question: What does 'allergen' mean?
options: A substance that causes an allergic reaction in the immune system

questions.question: What is 'immunodeficiency'?
options: A state in which the immune system's ability to fight infection is compromised or absent

questions.question: What is the 'lymphatic system'?
options: A network of tissues, organs, and vessels that helps maintain fluid balance and supports immune function

questions.question: What does 'pathogenesis' describe?
options: The process by which a disease develops in the body

questions.question: What is 'herd immunity'?
options: A form of indirect protection that occurs when a large percentage of a population becomes immune
Immunity gained from eating certain foods

questions.question: What are 'cytokines'?
options: Small proteins released by cells that have specific effects on cell communication and immune regulation

questions.question: What is 'anaphylaxis'?
options: A severe, potentially life-threatening allergic reaction that occurs rapidly
A gradual onset of allergy symptoms
